laws.summary: Non-competes PROHIBITED for most tech/creative workers
requirements: Non-competes PROHIBITED for most tech/creative workers

Hawaii prohibits non-compete agreements for technology workers and employees earning less than $100,000/year (effective 2022). Enforceable only for executive/management earning $100k+ or if business is sold.
Action required: Remove non-compete OR verify employee earns $100k+ and is executive
Can only use for executives earning $100k+ or business sale
laws.notes: Hawaii prohibits non-compete agreements for technology workers and employees earning less than $100,000/year (effective 2022). Enforceable only for executive/management earning $100k+ or if business is sold.

requirements: CANNOT inquire about salary history
Employers cannot inquire about prospective employee's compensation history or require that history satisfies minimum/maximum criteria.
Action required: Remove all salary history questions
laws.notes: Employers cannot inquire about prospective employee's compensation history or require that history satisfies minimum/maximum criteria.

laws.summary: Cannot inquire about convictions until after conditional offer
requirements: Cannot inquire about convictions until after conditional offer
Employers cannot ask about or consider arrest or criminal records until after conditional job offer made.
Action required: Ensure background check occurs post-offer
Delay criminal history inquiry until after conditional offer
laws.notes: Employers cannot ask about or consider arrest or criminal records until after conditional job offer made.

requirements: Hawaii minimum wage: $14.00/hour (2024-2027), $18.00/hour by 2028
